intro: Diostea scoparia, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. The plant has a taproot system that allows it to access deep water sources, and its leaves are usually covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Diostea scoparia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
